intro: Reseda alba var. undata, commonly known as white sweet rocket, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields.
